snippet: With two days to go before the election, the actor Harry Belafonte, a supporter of Bill de Blasio, referred to the Koch brothers, the wealthy supporters of Joseph J. Lhota, as “white supremacists.”
abstract: Actor Harry Belafonte, a supporter of New York Democratic mayoral candidate Bill de Blasio, refers to billionaire Koch brothers, the wealthy supporters of Republican opponent Joseph J Lhota, as 'white supremacists'; Lhota quickly issues stern rebuke, demanding that de Blasio denounce the actor's comments.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and MICHAEL BARBARO

lead_paragraph: With two days to go before the election, the actor Harry Belafonte, a supporter of Bill de Blasio, referred to the Koch brothers, the wealthy supporters of Joseph J. Lhota, as “white supremacists.”

headline.main: Supporter’s Caustic Remark Spices Up Mayoral Campaign’s Final Days
headline.print_headline: Supporter’s Caustic Remark Spices Up Mayoral Campaign’s Final Days
